alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 11:07AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON MST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to noon MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
